p: The active ingredients of medicinal and aromatic plants extracts are in the roots, stems, bark, leaves, or flowers [ 17]. Most times, the actions of these active ingredients on the human CNS could be associated with ecological roles or biochemical identities in other plants and higher animals [ 23]. The significant steps to utilize these biologically active compounds from plant resources involve the extraction, primary screening, isolation, purification, and characterization as well as pharmacological and toxicological analyses [ 24].
